forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 7 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is tinged with a melancholic charm, casting a soft glow over the streets. Tonight’s forecast hints at a plush, overcast blanket with temperatures hovering around fifty degrees, accompanied by a gentle westerly breeze, whispering secrets of the sea. The clouds above seem thick and brooding, a reminder of the marine layer lingering just beyond, wrapping the city in a serene shroud, yet parts of the sky hint at the potential for clarity that could emerge with morning's light.

As we turn our gaze toward tomorrow, expect a day painted in shades of gray; skies will remain mostly clouded, with high temperatures peaking around fifty-seven, only to slip to something cooler in the afternoon. The brisk winds, stirring between seven to eighteen miles per hour, will pierce through the urban landscape, reminding us that spring carries both warmth and chill. Given this interplay of elements, a light jacket or layered attire would serve well, providing warmth against the cool caress of the wind. 

As the evening unfolds, this may be the perfect time to explore a new café or retreat to a cozy bookshop, letting the outdoor coolness remind you of the warmth within. Discovering art in hidden galleries or chatting with friends in low-lit bars might bring a sense of comfort as the city hums along, draped in its soft evening cloak.
